Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text:
The cursed planet. After first tracking her as a red glimmer some Kerbal scientists pointed a larger telescope her way and quickly considered early retirement. Although she lacks considerably in gravity, her looks, among other things, will effectively repel passing landers.
It is believed she may have had an atmosphere rich in combustible materials but a massive impact ignited it and disfigured her.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text:
The concepts of identical and binary twins are far from foreign to Kerbalkind. But to find this in Gael's shadow!
Nothing could accelerate a space program more than the dream to land on a second planet where it is safe to take off your helmet and grill food for the crew. The one big problem, however, is all the gravioli.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text: That's right. Tarsiss is a moon of a moon. But that's only just the bottom of the grocery list of awesome things about it. Hopefully said list includes many edibles.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Description Left
Text.Text:
GPP throws spanners and wrenches into the typical ISRU experience, semi-realistically, making your favorite resources and other select resources scarce on certain worlds and always abundant on others; or exclusively present or absent at certain worlds or biomes. Hunting for them whilst using USI MKS and SCANsat just got better (or worse depending on your outlook) and omnipresent Stock Ore is no longer ubiquitous.
For a little guidance on what may be present in a body's atmosphere check out the planetary/munar pages for the elemental breakdowns. You may just find that resource you're looking for.
For added ISRU fun and new design opportunities along with the challenge, install the Karbonite mod by USI. Karbonite's massive presence in this system enables you to do previously impossible things like deploy on-ocean mining bases, make VTOLs and other aircraft that work in any atmosphere, refill tanks faster than they empty in flight, refuel while in space or entering/leaving atmosphere, and refine not only into LFO and Monopropellant but also into LqdHydrogen, Oxygen and gain Monopropellant via Karbonite's rocket alternators.
There are 4 hard-to-find places that house Karborundum. Additional resources featured are MetalOre for Extraplanetary Launchpads and the essentials for Kerbalism. The planet [REDACTED] has Oxygen and Water oceans making it the next level of testing ground for hypersonic and/or over-engineered aircraft.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text: The first of the gas giants is a very mellow and very yellow entity. The sight of him and his fellow amber moons is breathtaking. Even the rowdiest individual quietens down when they catch Otho staring back at them.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text: The beautiful orange skies on Niven made mouths water on first observation. Kerbalkind now knows that since it's closer to the star it's going to be a little warmer outdoors than anyone is accustomed to on Gael.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text: Rightfully named, this planet kommands the stellar kourt and wears his rings oblique for all to behold. Some Kerbals have gathered under a belief that a Heaven exists in his domain, filled with snacks that no corporeal Kerbal can reach or fathom.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text: This moon has been politely described as a malformed peanut butter cup by the scientist who found it... and who happened to be munching on one at the same time of the declaration. Given its sheer lack of size how did that Kerbal even notice?

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text:
The topography of this moon is among the most intriguing or muse-inducing ever seen. Conventional Geo-science cannot explain how Muse got his enormous swept gorges and wheat or cauliflower-like patches.
Perhaps he made a grave misdeed and invoked Nero's wrath.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text:
Another rather gorgeous moon, although one that looks roughed up on one side like that ice cream scoop back at the KSC that was dropped on the floor.
Nonetheless, sightseeing trips here may prove quite fulfilling.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text: Like everything else in Gauss' SOI this celestial body has amazing qualities. Hmmm... maybe the amazing part is that they lack nothing? ...Eh, Loki is a defiant moon in any case.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text: The recognised border world. The least amount of information is known about this rogue scoop of snowcone. The only sure fire thought is that its orbital properties render it a very un-affordable snowcone to visit.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text:
A 'Nereid', also a very different flavor of planetoid. This maiden clearly wandered by and paid more than one visit to Nero's kourt in her lifetime.
Julia found herself invited to hang around but not worthy to be in very close proximity.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text: Jannah seems analogous to that one kid in the class who nobody ever minded, or who always avoided everyone. Either way, if she senses that a landing party has pity on her she may just get a bit touchy and threaten to raise her orbit or inclination.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text:
The easiest thing to spot in the sky; its smooth yet gritty textures and neutral colors may have made it the first celestial body to be associated with snacks.
For many years Gaeleans have reached up towards Iota and stretched their fingertips ever closer.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Description Left
Text.Text:
A solar system mod unlike any other. Kerbals, effectively Gaeleans, arise on the 4th planet, Gael. Kerbin and the rest of the stock solar system do/did not exist and with 27 celestial bodies orbiting Ciro "the Sun" this system is as large by count and orbital radii as Stock + the Outer Planets Mod (OPM). This mod exists to make KSP feel new again to long-time players who have grown tired of launching from Kerbin, tired of stock or stockalike planets* in general and tired of meeting the same suite of challenges they know in the stock system.
Unique patterns occurred during the formation of Ciro and the planets from their circumstellar disc, leading to meticulous, almost deliberate allocations of precious resources with the leftovers forming into an organic, combustible system with strangely allocated abundances compared to other solar systems. The Ciro system itself develops a collection of stories and is of many special attractions as gameplay matures such as the daunting Icarus, the curse of Thalia and the configurations of Gauss and its moons.
Every world is named after Graeco-Roman culture and each has a story to tell, whether by in-game descriptions, the challenges they pose to players, the names of their biomes or merely their looks. Gael and her moons present custom science statements to provide additional exposition.
* The upmost respect is intended towards stockalike planets and their makers. OPM is honored wholeheartedly for setting the bar for solar system mods and its bodies are used as references within this pack.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text: It took a long time to discover this gem due to its size and its proximity to the inferno. Its appearance strongly inspires thoughts of seafood and a visit would be as exquisite. The ability to get here and back without bankrupting KSC, melting or upsetting Gael's biosphere would be treated with great prestige.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text: Whilst Leto is the officially recognised border world, Hox may prove to be a much more desirable place to settle down at and open a restaurant, or visit one. Posessing an incredibly thin atmosphere though, it may be hard to get that slice of Kerbal Krunch past your helmet visor.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text:
The name of this moon invokes thoughts and connotations of smithing and construction. Evidently it sure seems to be the workplace of higher beings, looking like it its own self burst open and bled under unfathomable workloads.
Given the aesthetics of the other planets they did quite the job.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text: The only world bearing oceans between Gratian and Leto, Hadrian wears the mantle of King of the Moons and offers royal frozen treats to explorers. It may just be that Nero's incorporeal edible treasures lay here.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text: In decades past a poetically inclined Kerbal, being close friends with a chef, often had dreams of a world filled with spicy food. They inspired highly eccentric stories that were hidden until his passing. One of these stories even went as far as to say something about controlling this spice and the universe. Maybe he was onto something...

Text.Name: Note
Text.Text: ** TRANSFER ΔV ASSUMES HOHMANN TRANSFER ORBIT WITH ZERO PLANE CHANGE [VALUE] IS MAX PLANE CHANGE ΔV

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text:
As long as Kerbalkind has known the light they have known about a little red glimmer that hung in the sky and to this day dances with Ciro and Gael.
Always finding it irresistible to point lenses at, Kerbals have referenced Grannus in stories new and long forgotten but its proximity and lack of planets have made it a none too great travel destination.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Spec TH
Text.Text:

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text:
Ignoring its incline, this curious black pearl occupies its parent's geo-synchronous altitude, causing the moon to appear tidally locked to it!
If Geminus was a little better fed in the proto-days it would be as wide as Gratian! Aha, Geminus is almost Gemini!

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text:
The most trivial of the gas giants... or is he? This particularly restless blue world is home to more than one superstorm and regularly exercises immense electromagnetic powers of RUD!
Beware, for all is not as it seems in Gauss' SOI.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text: A terrestrial planet, Homeworld of the Kerbals. Despite their penchant for mega-structures, Kerbals make every effort to ensure that the ecological balance of their world is not disturbed and much of the planet remains an untouched wilderness.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Spec TH
Text.Text:

Text.Name: Panel Body/Flags/Flag (1)/Flag Desc. (1)
Text.Text: "Purple Moons" Catullus and Tarsiss look alike and are uniquely exceptional, deserving their own flag.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Flags/Flag (2)/Flag Desc. (2)
Text.Text: "House of Nero" The most fabulous of flags for the most fabulous of planets.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Flags/Flag (3)/Flag Desc. (3)
Text.Text: An inverse version in case the first one doesn't show well on some parts of a craft.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Flags/Flag (4)/Flag Desc. (4)
Text.Text: "Hox" The first of the ice planets and border-world of the ice worlds region.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Flags/Flag (5)/Flag Desc. (5)
Text.Text: "The Ice Life" Flag for any and all of the ice worlds.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Flags/Flag (6)/Flag Desc. (6)
Text.Text: "The Three Kings" A challenge flag to be used on vessels that transit soley to the gas planets, and all of them, and no other planet except Gael.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Flags/Flag (7)/Flag Desc. (7)
Text.Text: "Grand Tour Gold" What it says on the tin.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Flags/Flag (8)/Flag Desc. (8)
Text.Text: "Grand Tour Silver" This flag pardons players who can do the grand tour excepting Catullus but no other world.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Description Right
Text.Text:
It can be a bit cumbersome to manage the additional GPP flags alongside the array of stock flags but by using the Decal Stickers mod you can get the best of both worlds where craft compatibilities are concerned.
Utilising 'decals' for your flags, crafts shared outside of GPP will only break if the Decal Stickers mod is absent. They will not require Galileo's Planet Pack itself in order to stay valid.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Flags/Flag (1)/Flag Desc. (1)
Text.Text: "Isle of Ciro" associated with Icarus which orbits the star more closely than Moho does.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Flags/Flag (2)/Flag Desc. (2)
Text.Text: "Oh Thalia" associated with the badlands-esque planet Thalia.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Flags/Flag (3)/Flag Desc. (3)
Text.Text: "Jolly Thalia" for any hardcore pirate faction.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Flags/Flag (4)/Flag Desc. (4)
Text.Text: "Gaeo Tao" the default and all-purpose flag. Associated mainly with Gael but can include Niven.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Flags/Flag (5)/Flag Desc. (5)
Text.Text: "Republica Gaelia" The flag of organizational regimes and anything on the grand scale.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Flags/Flag (6)/Flag Desc. (6)
Text.Text: "Al Tellum" Tellumo is a sacred place among planets, deadly to approach for the common Kerbal.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Flags/Flag (7)/Flag Desc. (7)
Text.Text: "Grat and Gem" of Gratian, the red planet, and its swirling dry seas.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Flags/Flag (8)/Flag Desc. (8)
Text.Text: "The Oth" flag of Otho, the first gas giant and its Hallowed Space and the fellow yellow moons.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Flags/Flag (9)/Flag Desc. (9)
Text.Text: "Max Gauss" associated with Gauss and the Moons in Mischief.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Description Right
Text.Text:
Over a dozen flags are provided for the Galileo's Planet Pack mod to show off on your crafts wherever in the Ciro system you’re taking care of business or whatever major feat you’re attempting for your playthrough.
These flags will appear near the top of the flag selection window in-game, so ensure you scroll right to the top.
If you wish to install the Decal Stickers mod, GPP will enable these decal parts to be placed and tiled anywhere about your craft. You can do this when constructing your craft within the VAB/SPH.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text: As far as Kerbalkind knows, this is the most petite body around. Her relationship with Thalia is akin to Sleeping Beauty and Maleficent.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Spec TH
Text.Text: KERBIN MASSES: RADIUS: SURFACE G: BIOME COUNT: PLANET CLASS: VOLCANISM: INTERCEPT ΔV**: LOW ORBIT INS ΔV: RE-LAUNCH ΔV: ORBITAL PERIOD: SEMI MAJOR AXIS: SOI RANGE: ORB. ECCENTRICITY: ORBITAL INCLINATION: ROTATIONAL PERIOD: SYNC ORBIT ALT:

Text.Name: Note
Text.Text: ** INTERCEPT ΔV ASSUMES MAXIMUM ELLIPTICAL ORBIT WITH PARENT AND GOOD TIMING [VALUE] IS MAX PLANE CHANGE ΔV

Text.Name: Panel Body/Description Left
Text.Text:
Included in the following pages are complete Delta-V maps for the GPP system which use values derived from the following: minimum transfer Δv is by simple Hohmann Transfer with zero plane change with bodies at their mean distance from Ciro, plane change Δv is as a mid-course correction (90° from intercept) at the target planet's maximum displacement from the ecliptic plane. Please let it be noted that the user should never assume that numbers in any Delta-V map are exactly accurate as small orbital differences can affect flight paths greatly over large distances. Elliptical orbits are listed with maximum eccentricity without SOI escape and with periapsis at 10 km above atmosphere edge or highest point on terrain. Ciro's elliptical orbit apogee is Gael's SMA.
For upscaled solar systems, multiply any Delta-V value by the square root of the rescale value. Numbers coloured white in square brackets, [], are maximum amounts required via a plane-change. Numbers coloured orange are the total Delta-V required to approach that point [+ any plane change]; for parent planets these values show the total Delta-V required to land on that body. Atmospheric bodies assume that no fuel is spent during the landing phase i.e. parachute landing (excepting Hox).
For those who like to refer to a Delta-V map outside of the game please direct your attention to the root folder of the Galileo's Planet Pack download archive. A full Delta-V Map in the traditional, sub-way map, style is included for your reference.

Text.Name: Note (1)
Text.Text: * ADDITIONAL ΔV MAY BE REQUIRED TO REVERSE DIRECTION OF ORBIT.

Text.Name: Panel Body/dV Map/Note
Text.Text: * Hox's 'Landed' total ΔV requirements shown do not factor in aerobraking/ aerocapture as Hox exhibits an extremely low density atmosphere.

Text.Name: Panel Body/Description Left
Text.Text:
MAIN DEVELOPERS
Galileo - Foundation, main conceptualization of bodies, major support for career mode and contract mods.
JadeOfMaar - Resource configs, documentation, storytelling, perf. testing, supporting graphics.
OhioBob - Documentation, atmospheric configs, everything else involving Math/Science, perf. testing.
Nhawks17 - Kerbal Konstructs.
Poodmund - Tools and tutorials, optimizations, initial biome work, KSPedia implementation.
rasta013 - Biome descriptions
TheRagingIrishman - Renamer & Install Plugins, Localization
3RD PARTY MOD SUPPORT
Chimer4, CatastrophicFailure - Kerbalism
Chase842 - KSP Interstellar Extended (not included)

Text.Name: Panel Body/Description Right
Text.Text:
SCREENSHOTS FOR PLANETS & LOADING SCREEN
- Kamuchi
- eddiew
- Norcalplanner
- astroheiko
- GPP Devs

Text.Name: Panel Body/Quote
Text.Text:
"Ciro, with all those planets revolving around it and dependent on it, can still munch a bunch of snacks as if it had nothing else in the universe to do."
"The laws of nature are written by the hand of the Kraken in the language of mathematics."
"You cannot teach Kerbals anything; you can only help them find it within themselves."
- Galileo Kerman

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text:
Among trillions of other G-Type stars Ciro is nothing special but is smaller and dimmer than the typical Kerbal star, making Gael seem a little far and cold. Many of those other stars undoubtedly hold celestial bodies very similar and different to the ones here...
How many of them have perfect planets like Gael and Tellumo, to play and snack outside without spacesuits? This is why we have space programs.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Spec TH
Text.Text:

Text.Name: Note
Text.Text: * ELLIPTICAL ORBIT WITH GAEL AT APOAPSIS AND PERIAPSIS 10KM ABOVE ATMOSPHERE LIMIT

Text.Name: Panel Body/Description Left
Text.Text:
This solar system provides a very wide array of challenges, some of which are rather classical but occur sooner or later relative to the Kerbin system; others are completely new.
* Firstly, the Kerbal Space Center is not on the equator. This adds difficulty to the beginning and the end of absolutely every mission. Be prepared to spend 345m/s every time after orbital insertion to get equatorial.
* There are four deadly non-gas bodies to visit, two of which have extreme atmospheres but all feature splendour and wonder making it worth your time to visit them all.
* Ore is not omnipresent. One or more planets will have a nearly zero abundance of materials. Certain other resources are completely absent on specific worlds too.
* Colonization, the grand tour and general use of life support mods need extra, extra planning with regards to the previous points and the sheer size of this solar system.
* Gael's moons have just 5 biomes which delivers, or helps to deliver, the long-awaited challenge and thrill of going far beyond Gael's SOI edge before your Tech Tree is completely unlocked.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text: This is another unique but somewhat unpalatable entry on the list of local bodies. The revelation of its higher mass and gravity than Iota is a turning point in astronomy, meanwhile its visuals are a turning point for some to the SPH's barf bag shelf.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text:
The discovery of this double-natured body came as nothing short of perplexing. It displays properties of both a super-Gael and a gas giant; even orbiting the latter!
Whilst the science community butts heads about the matter, the aviation community has found one mind and declared that the rite of passage leads through Catullus.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text:
Augustus is an obedient follower of the giant Otho and is the best place to visit whilst gazing back into space with a parent body in view.
Everything is bathed in its wonderful tangerine color and his skies are friendlier to non-space planes than those of Niven.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text: A curious and entertaining little thing, Argo is a siren amongst moons. Pilots en route to Hox may find themselves teased and promised by the thoughts of pleasant times there but do not worry about its appearance, Argo is a peaceful and tranquil, albeit lively, rock.

Text.Name: Left Panel/Body Name/Description
Text.Text:
A 'Nereid', a beautiful green and gray planetoid which lurks near the outer reaches of Nero's influence. Given Agrippina's size, Gaelean Science has not yet confirmed whether she was captured or formed locally being kicked out to her current high orbit.
Nero must have gotten very upset at her for some reason.
